awd_titl_txt: Tsuris in the Soul:  Contentious Inter-Ethnic Politics      and the Black-Jewish Question
awd_abstract_narration: This project investigates cycles of inter-ethnic conflict.  The argument is that anti-government protests by minorities generate a cycle of contention involving collective action processes -- counter-mobilization, bandwagons, external patronage, and intra-community competition -- that affect the likelihood of inter-ethnic conflict and cooperation.  The PIs apply this theory of inter-ethnic relations to the case of Blacks and Jews in the United States.  While conventional wisdom indicates that Black-Jewish relations have deteriorated in recent years, systematic description and explanation is virtually absent.  This work examines Black-Jewish interactions in New York City from 1900-1997.  It codes data from a variety of news sources and uses ARIMA intervention estimation and hazard models to test the model.  The research contributes to our understanding of two established fields -- social movements and Black protest.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
